@Ignasier: I don't know if I agree about hilarious art and flavour being entirely missing, but there is certainly less of it than there used to be.

The actual pop culture reference, by the way, is to the painting American Gothic. (just in case anybody didn't know and was curious)

It's not cheap, but mass land destruction is not something you see very much any more - never mind in the uncommon slot!

posts.post_content:
[Braid of Fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Braid of Fire) and no mana burn means this just got a whole lot better. For your reference, here's a cost chart for this card's ability:  
  
Destroy 1 land: ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) (equal to [Stone Rain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stone Rain))  
Destroy 2 lands: ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
Destroy 3 lands: ![6](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=6&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
Destroy 4 lands: ![8](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=8&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
Destroy 5 lands: ![10](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=10&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
Destroy 6 lands: ![12](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=12&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
Destroy 7 lands: ![14](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=14&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
Destroy 8 lands: ![16](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=16&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
Destroy 9 lands: ![18](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=18&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
Destroy 10 lands: ![20](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=20&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
  
As you can see, this is not bad in the lower end, but can get quite costly.
